title: INNOVATION & CREATIVE THINKING
description: The key ingredient of Leadership today is all about coping with change. Change can be initiated and based on different situations or events, or sometimes aspirations. It can be NECESSARY, or induced by AMBITION, by something OUTSIDE or something INSIDE our company, it can be NATURAL or it can be FORCED. In Order to cope with change, you need to be creative, innovative, a problem solver and an effective communicator. In this 2 days program, you will learn what is change all about, how to break change resistance, how to think differently in order to win, progress and solve problems. You will be introduced to various case studies from history, from successful companies that adopt to change with induced innovation & creativity and also companies that disappeared when they refused to move out from their comfort zone. This course is unique because it focuses a lot on history, stories, plenty of case studies and videos. Most of the slides here are only pictures with a lot of deep meaning. You are assured to learn plenty from this class & people will go back highly motivated with the desire to use creative thinking to change something for the best in order to be competitive, profitable & continuously improving to delight themselves & their customers
target_audience: Engineers Managers, Supervisors Shop floor personnel Continuous improvement personnel Team leaders Executives Change agents
methodology: informative presentation, Group discussion & Presentations, Real Case Studies, Discussions & Brainstorming Sessions, Video Presentations.
learning_objectives: ["Understand what is change and the importance of change.", "Learn how to break change resistance by changing the mindset and adapting to change.", "Be able to implement creative thinking.", "Be able to be a good influencer & establish great change agents .", "Go back highly motivated", "Be a creative problem solver"]
learning_outcomes: ["Understand what is change and the importance of change.", "Learn how to break change resistance by changing the mindset and adapting to change.", "Be able to implement creative thinking.", "Be able to be a good influencer & establish great change agents .", "Go back highly motivated", "Be a creative problem solver"]

title: 8D PROBLEM SOLVING
description: At many times, problems are not defined clearly, decisions are only based on assumptions or hunches anda systematic approach is not used. Because of all these issues, the 8-Disciplines Problem Solving Technique or 8D was pioneered by the Ford Motor Company and is commonly used to solve complex problems. It provides a systematic and effective approach to solve a problem and promotes the use of expertise and experience within the organization to address the root cause. 8D uses composite problem-solving methodology, by borrowing tools and techniques from various approaches. This workshop will use an 80% practical hands-on & 20% theory approach
target_audience: Engineers, managers, supervisors, manufacturing personnel, quality personnel, safety personnel, maintenance, continuous improvement personnel, team leaders and executives who are responsible in analyzing and solving a problem.
methodology: Informative presentation, Group Activities, Discussions & Presentations, Real Case Studies, One segment of practical 8D Problem Solving (80% Practical Activities)
learning_objectives: ["Use structured problem solving and corrective action methodology based on the 8D process", "model.", "Enhance organizational ability to trace a problem to the root cause level.", "Incorporate applicable QC tools within the 8D process."]
learning_outcomes: ["Effectively implement these disciplines in your organization", "Develop action plans to perform problem solving activities using the 8D methodology.", "Promote multidisciplinary team approach and a strong problem-solving culture.", "Eliminate repeated problems and coming up with lasting solutions."]

title: AI-POWERED TRANSFORMATION: UNLOCKING EFFICIENCY FOR SECRETARIAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE PROFESSIONALS
description: In todays rapidly evolving digital landscape, secretarial and administrative roles are transforming from traditional support functions to strategic enablers. This course is designed to empower professionals in these roles with cutting-edge AI tools and automation techniques, equipping them to enhance productivity, streamline workflows, and add greater value to their organizations. Participants will gain practical insights into how AI and automation can revolutionize their day-to- day tasks and future-proof their careers in an increasingly tech-driven world.
target_audience: Executive Assistants, Personal Assistants, and Administrative Professionals. Office Managers and Secretarial Staff. Professionals responsible for managing workflows, documentation, and communications.
methodology: Classroom Group activity
prerequisite: To ensure an optimal learning experience, participants should: Have basic computer literacy (e.g., familiarity with Microsoft Office or Google Workspace). Be comfortable navigating common digital tools like email and cloud-based file storage. Have a willingness to learn and adapt to new technology. Have access to Microsoft Power Automate web and desktop with the appropriate license (included in most Microsoft 365 subscriptions, such as Business Standard or higher). No prior knowledge of AI or automation is required. All concepts and tools will be explained in simple, practical terms, with step-by-step guidance during hands-on sessions.
learning_objectives: ["Understand the fundamentals of AI and its applications in administrative workflows.", "Identify opportunities for AI and automation to optimize routine tasks.", "Gain hands-on experience with free tools like Microsoft Power Automate and AI-based", "software for task management, communication, and document handling.", "Develop a personalized action plan for implementing AI-driven solutions in their roles."]
learning_outcomes: ["Familiarise with AI tools for administrative tasks.", "Understand how to design and deploy simple automation workflows using tools like Power", "Automate to reduce lower value tasks.", "Transition from a support-focused role to a strategic contributor within their organization.", "Be equipped to continuously adapt to new technologies and lead transformation initiatives."]

title: LEAN MANUFACTURING
description: This workshop must be attended if your operations need to become more responsive to your customers needs. You will be introduced to the many concepts that fall under the umbrella of lean, more so you will also get tangible ideas that you can take back to work and implement. Lean is a process that can help you to substantially reduce inventories, Work-In-Process, required floor space, cycle times and lead times. It can also dramatically improve quality connecting processes and people to allow errors to be caught faster.
target_audience: Change Agents, CI Personnel, Supervisors, Managers, Engineers, Executives, or anyone who wants to make process improvements
methodology: Informative presentation, Group discussion & Presentations, Real Case Studies & Video Presentations, Value Analysis Activities
learning_objectives: ["Be able to analyze value", "Serve as an eye-opener to see & attack waste", "To be able to start lean transformation projects which are effective", "Learn the lean culture", "To reduce lead time", "To be relevant in the eyes of the customer by providing value added services"]
learning_outcomes: ["Understand and implement lean activities", "Able to understand wastes in the shop-floor", "Able to differentiate between value and non-value added activities in order to transform to", "become a lean organization"]

title: E-INVOICING
description: The Inland Revenue Board of Malaysia (IRBM) has officially announced the phased implementation of the new Electronic Invoice (e-invoice) system, marking a pivotal shift in business transactions.Under Section 82 of the Income Tax Act 1967, e invoicing will gradually roll out starting from August 1, 2024, with full enforcement slated for 2025.This initiative aims to bolster efficiency in business transactions and compliance with tax regulations, impacting sole proprietors, private limited companies, and a spectrum of businesses involved in goods and services trade. Recognizing the significant shift, this e-invoice course offers a comprehensive checklist, delving into crucial aspects such as software capabilities, self-billing procedures, consolidated e-invoicing methods, disbursement, and reimbursement protocols, management of employee benefits and expense claims, buyer request options, and the requisite IT infrastructure and more.
target_audience: CFO Accounts Manager Accounts Executive Accounts Assistant Operation Manager Sales Manager Shiff Operation Manager
methodology: Real case studies IRB Guideline Interactive Power Point Q&A for each module
learning_objectives: ["This training helps business owners, accountants, finance professionals,", "and bookkeepers regarding the intricacies of accounting in the e-invoicing era.", "By providing comprehensive guidance and practical insights, attendees will be", "equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively manage", "business and accounting processes amidst the transition to electronic invoicing,", "thereby minimizing disruptions and maximizing operational efficiency."]
learning_outcomes: ["Understanding what is E-Invoicing", "The E-Invoicing rules in Malaysia 0002", "Benefits of E-Invoicing", "E-Invoicing process description", "E-Invoice implementation timeline", "E-Invoicing: Impact on strategies and operations", "(And, with Latest Updates)"]

title: MICROSOFT EXCEL (BASIC)
description: Welcome to the Excel Basic Training program, your gateway to mastering essential spreadsheet skills. In this course, we'll delve into fundamental topics starting with Basic Data Entry, where you'll learn the ins and outs of inputting information accurately. We'll then explore the art of Data Formatting, guiding you in presenting your data with clarity and visual appeal. Formula Basics will empower you with calculation prowess, while strategies for Working with Rows and Columns ensure seamless data organization. As we journey further, you'll gain proficiency in Editing Worksheets, refining your data with precision, and conclude by mastering the intricacies of Printing Worksheets for effective on- screen and paper presentation. Whether you're a novice or an experienced user, this course is tailored to elevate your Excel skills, providing a solid foundation and refining your expertise. Join us for this transformative learning experience, and let's embark together on the path to Excel mastery!
target_audience: Office admin Senior Executive & Managers Engineers
methodology: Face-to-Face or Online Hands-on exercises
prerequisite: The minimum Excel version is Microsoft Excel 2016
learning_objectives: ["Develop proficiency in Basic Data Entry", "Master Data Formatting techniques", "Acquire strategies for Working with Rows and Columns", "Enhance skills in Editing Worksheets"]
learning_outcomes: ["Participants able to ensure accurate and organized information input for effective", "spreadsheet management", "Participants can present information visually and comprehensibly for enhanced data", "representation", "Participants able to organize and manipulate data efficiently", "Participants can modify and refine data with precision and efficiency"]

title: MICROSOFT POWER BI
description: If you're not already familiar with it, Power BI is a powerful business intelligence tool that enables you to create visually appealing and interactive reports and dashboards. With this tool, you can easily analyze your business data and gain insights that will help you make more informed decisions. The aim of this training program is to provide beginners with a comprehensive understanding of Power BI and its features.
target_audience: This training program is intended for individuals with little or no experience in Power BI who are looking to gain the necessary skills to effectively use the tool for data visualization and business intelligence purposes.
methodology: The training will be delivered through a combination of lectures, hands-on exercises, and real-world projects. The lectures will introduce participants to the various features and functionality of Power BI, while the hands-on exercises will allow participants to apply their knowledge and gain practical experience. The real-world projects will provide participants with an opportunity to apply their skills to a real-life scenario.
prerequisite: Basic computer skills, including proficiency in using Windows operating system, web browsers, and Microsoft Office applications Familiarity with basic data concepts such as tables, columns, and rows Understanding of basic statistical concepts such as averages, percentages, and standard deviations Familiarity with data visualization concepts such as charts, graphs, and tables
learning_objectives: ["Connect and import data from various sources into Power BI", "Create and format basic visualizations such as charts, tables, and maps", "Create interactive dashboards and reports", "Apply data transformations using DAX formulas", "Share and publish Power BI reports and dashboards"]
learning_outcomes: ["Participants will be able to use Power Query Editor to prepare a proper dataset for their", "analysis", "Participants will be able to use Power BI Desktop to generate their data analysis", "Participants will be able to publish and share their reports in Power BI Service"]

These metrics or what is commonly referred to as measures, range widely depending on the customer and type of organization. Towards the end of the program, participants will create a working dashboard.

title: Microsoft Excel Intermediate Training
description: Welcome to the Excel Intermediate Training program, where we're set to enhance your Excel skills. Throughout this course, we'll delve into essential topics, starting with reinforcing Formula Basics, ensuring you have a robust understanding for more complex calculations. We'll then explore practical aspects such as Working with Multiple Worksheets, diving into effective strategies for organizing and managing data across various sheets. As we progress, we'll unravel the power of text manipulation with Working with Text Formulas and venture into time-related calculations in Working with Date and Time Formulas. The course will guide you through creating dynamic formulas with Conditional Formulas, visually enhancing your data through Conditional Formatting, ensuring data integrity with Data Validation, and finally, crafting formulas that efficiently lookup values. By the end of this program, you'll not only master advanced Excel features but also gain the confidence to apply them in real-world scenarios. Join us on this journey toward Excel mastery!
prerequisite: Completed Excel Beginner training course Minimum Excel version is Microsoft Excel 2016
learning_objectives: ["The objectives of this 2-days training program are as follows:", "Enhance participants' understanding of Formula Basics, ensuring they can", "confidently construct and manipulate formulas for various calculations in Excel", "Equip participants with the skills to effectively work with Multiple Worksheets,", "enabling them to organize, manage, and analyze data seamlessly across different", "sheets", "Empower participants with advanced techniques in Working with Text Formulas and", "Working with Date and Time Formulas, enabling them to manipulate textual data", "and perform sophisticated calculations involving temporal information", "Enable participants to dynamically adapt formulas with Conditional Formulas,", "visually enhance data through Conditional Formatting, ensure data accuracy with", "Data Validation, and efficiently retrieve information from various sources through", "formulas that lookup values"]

title: BASIC CONVERSATIONAL: BAHASA MALAYSIA COURSE FOR FOREIGN WORKERS
description: For newly arrived foreign workers, effective communication in Bahasa Malaysia is essential for successful integration into the workplace and the broader Malaysian community. Many workers face language barriers that can limit their ability to follow instructions, interact with supervisors, and perform their roles efficiently. By equipping them with basic conversational skills in Bahasa Malaysia, this course aims to reduce misunderstandings, enhance workplace safety, and improve overall productivity. The course is designed with the unique needs of foreign workers in mind, focusing on practical phrases and workplace-relevant communication. Lessons are delivered in a highly interactive format, incorporating translation support to bridge initial gaps. Participants will learn through role-play, repetition, and guided exercises to ensure retention. The goal is not only to enable functional communication but also to foster confidence and independence in using Bahasa Malaysia in everyday contexts.
target_audience: Foreign Workers
methodology: Instructor-led explanations with translation support Role-playing of workplace scenarios Group discussions and guided practice Audio-visual aids for listening and pronunciation practice Interactive exercises for real-world communication
learning_objectives: ["Build confidence in using basic conversational Bahasa Malaysia in workplace settings", "Learn essential vocabulary and phrases for daily interactions", "Practice correct pronunciation and listening comprehension", "Develop the ability to follow instructions and ask simple questions", "Enhance communication with supervisors and co-workers", "Promote safety and efficiency through better understanding of directions"]

title: FINANCE FOR NON-FINANCE PROFESSIONALS

learning_objectives: ["Conduct basic and advanced project appraisal.", "Use ROI", "Calculate NPV, FV and IRR", "Calculate financial ratios"]
learning_outcomes: ["This training employs adult learning techniques which include active learning strategies to facilitate understanding and retention.", "Participants will spend 50% of the time in individual or group activities which allow them to learn, develop and practice vital skills.", "The trainer will draw from the participants experiences to simulate real life situations and case studies to enhance the training."]

title: PENULISAN SURAT RASMI: TEKNIK, FORMAT, DAN ETIKET PROFESIONAL
description: Surat rasmi adalah medium komunikasi bertulis yang penting dalam organisasi dan urusan rasmi. Penulisan surat rasmi yang baik memerlukan penggunaan bahasa yang tepat, format yang standard, serta etika komunikasi yang betul. Kursus ini akan memberikan panduan menyeluruh tentang teknik menulis surat rasmi yang efektif, mematuhi format yang betul, dan memastikan mesej disampaikan dengan jelas dan profesional.
target_audience: Kursus ini sesuai untuk sesiapa sahaja yang ingin meningkatkan kemahiran mereka dalam menulis surat dengan gaya yang profesional, tatabahasa yang betul & format yang tepat.
methodology: Kursus ini menggunakan pendekatan pembelajaran interaktif melalui: Kuliah & Pembentangan Prinsip asas dan teknik penulisan surat rasmi. Latihan Praktikal Latihan menulis dan membetulkan surat rasmi. Kajian Kes Analisis surat rasmi yang baik dan kurang baik. Perbincangan Berkumpulan Perkongsian pengalaman dan sesi soal jawab. Tugasan Individu Menulis surat rasmi berdasarkan senario tertentu.
learning_objectives: ["Memahami kepentingan surat rasmi dalam komunikasi organisasi.", "Mempelajari format dan struktur asas surat rasmi.", "Menggunakan bahasa yang profesional, tepat, dan sopan dalam surat rasmi.", "Menulis surat rasmi untuk pelbagai tujuan seperti permohonan, aduan, dan jemputan.", "Mengelakkan kesilapan umum dalam penulisan surat rasmi.", "Mengaplikasikan etika dan tatacara penulisan surat rasmi dalam pelbagai situasi rasmi."]

title: CHEMICAL SAFETY MANAGEMENT FROM CRADLE TO GRAVE
description: Chemical handlers are highly prone to chemical hazardous exposures. They have a Right-To Know of their exposure to all the chemicals and scheduled wastes involved, as stated by the Occupational Safety Health Act 1994, the Environmental Quality Act 1974, and their regulations. A cradle-to-grave training module for chemical safety management would provide a comprehensive overview of the stages involved in the entire life cycle of the chemicals used in the industry. This module would include information about the chemical's origin, storage, usage, disposal, and other related processes. It would provide guidance on how to properly handle, the storage of hazardous chemicals and control measures to eliminate or reduce the workers exposure to hazardous chemicals, as well as how to safely dispose of them. This would also include training on the legal requirements for chemical safety management and the proper procedures for documentation and reporting. This module would also provide guidance on the necessary safety equipment and protective gear that must be used when handling hazardous chemicals. Additionally, it would provide information about the risks associated with chemical exposure and how to perform monitoring programs to review the exposure risk and prevent the occurrence of occupational exposure-related illnesses and diseases.
target_audience: Any employees that have direct or indirect involvement in hazardous chemical purchase, usage, storage, and disposal control, but not limited to; Safety and health officer Safety and health committee members Chemical handling workers Engineer that in-charge of the hazardous chemicals usage processes
methodology: Classroom
learning_objectives: ["Upon completion of this program, participants will:", "Have a better knowledge of the existing regulations on hazardous chemical usage,", "inventory control, and exposure, scheduled waste and industrial effluent handling,", "and chemical spillage response.", "Be able to segregate chemicals properly during storage and usage.", "Be able to apply the PPE and Engineering control involved properly.", "Be able to interpret Safety Data Sheet (SDS)", "Understand pre-purchase review and familiar with the key review criteria", "Have a better understanding of the existing/future improved chemical handling", "requirements, proper personal protective equipment, functions of local exhaust", "ventilation, and procedures for chemical spills/release.", "Be familiar with the chemical spill procedure and existing chemical spill equipment."]
learning_outcomes: ["Understand Chemical Safety Regulations", "Proper Chemical Segregation and Storage", "Apply Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and Engineering Controls", "Interpret Safety Data Sheets (SDS)", "Comprehend Chemical Handling and Spill Procedures", "Respond Effectively to Chemical Spills"]

title: Business Continuity Management
description: Business continuity is the ability of an entity to maintain vital functions before and after a disaster. Business continuity planning incorporates risk management procedures and processes that help avoid interruptions to essential business services while re-establishing full business functions quickly following an emergency. Business continuity is essential because it helps keep vital business functions up and running before and after a disaster with as little downtime as possible. A business continuity program considers unpredictable circumstances like disease outbreaks, fire outbreaks, natural disasters, cyberattacks, and other threats. It also helps businesses identify key functions for business performance to help allocate resources accordingly. It keeps the business running with minimum interferences during a crisis and helps keep the organizations resiliency. In this course, participants would learn about the infrastructure services that keep the entire organisations running optimally, from the network infrastructure as well as understanding the network requirements that is very much pertinent today. Participants will be exposed to the emerging technologies that could enhance their business continuity from typical cloud infrastructure setups to managing the operations based on the service level design of their network. The participants are provided with information of the industrial revolution that has been implemented across a variety of industries with real case examples as benchmark.
target_audience: Managers and Operational Team Crisis Manager Business Analyst/ Accountants IT/Supply Chain Management members Risk Management members
learning_objectives: ["Gain practical insight into business continuity plan development and how to", "implement it", "Understand the vital concepts and principles utilized in business continuity planning", "Learn the methodologies and terms used for resiliency and professional practices", "Prepare participants for the business continuity certification examinations", "Recognize the framework for boosting business productivity", "Learn about business evaluation skills and risk assessment", "Understand the roles and responsibilities of a business continuity planner and", "manager", "Understand how to design an efficient business continuity/disaster recovery plan", "Recognize and explain trends in the business continuity industry"]

title: SMART OFFICE COMMUNICATION: MASTERING MINUTE TAKING & OFFICIAL WRITING SKILLS
description: In todays fast-paced workplace, secretaries, administrators, and executive assistants are the communication bridge that keeps teams aligned and operations smooth. This course provides practical skills to improve written communication, enhance task coordination, and produce accurate, professional meeting minutes. Participants will also learn to write clear and well-structured official letters, internal memos, and emails that convey professionalism and confidence.
target_audience: This course is ideal for: Administrative and executive assistants Office administrators and coordinators Secretaries and personal assistants Clerical and support staff handling meeting documentation Anyone responsible for business correspondence or office communication
methodology: Instructor-led sessions with real-world case examples Group discussions on documentation practices and common challenges Hands-on exercises in note-taking, drafting, and filtering important content Peer collaboration and review to strengthen clarity and accuracy
learning_objectives: ["By the end of this program, participants will be able to:", "Apply professional communication principles in managing tasks, meetings, and", "correspondence.", "Record and prepare clear, concise, and action-oriented meeting minutes.", "Write professional official letters, memos, and business emails using the correct", "format and tone.", "Improve clarity, tone, and accuracy in all written communication.", "Enhance productivity through effective task planning, prioritization, and", "coordination."]

title: MINUTES MEETING FOR ORGANIZATION
description: Minutes of meetings provide a record of a groups decisions and actions. It serves as a record for future reference and also provides legal protection for the organization. Many times, due diligence is captured in companies meeting minutes, and documented to confirm the ethical and fair practices of the organization. Meeting notes serve as proof of why and how a company came to certain decisions. This is useful when any queries arise or decisions are challenged by those who werent present when the decisions were made. Whats the challenge in writing minutes? Knowing what to record, how much to record, which tense to write in, and which type of sentence or word will capture the essence of the meeting and the decisions or resolutions that have been passed.
learning_objectives: ["The objective of this training is to equip HR and Finance teams with the necessary skills and", "knowledge to effectively create, manage, and utilize meeting minutes. Participants will learn", "best practices for minute-taking, organization, and communication to enhance collaboration", "and decision-making within their respective teams"]

title: MENTAL HEALTH AWARENESS: EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL RESILIENCE
description: Program Introduction The COVID-19 pandemic has enormously affected the psychological well-being, social and working life of millions of people across the globe. The stigma of mental health is prevalent in Malaysia and according to the National Health and Morbidity Survey in 2019 report, half a million Malaysians were found to be experiencing symptoms of depression. Besides that, the onset of the pandemic has also led to an increase in cases of depression and anxiety. Ministry of Health (MOH) in 2021 has reported 85.5% of calls to government agencies since the pandemic were inquiring about mental health issues. Many of those calls required psychological and emotional support and counselling. MOH predicts that mental health is currently the 2nd highest health issue in Malaysia after heart disease. Challenges now arise when employed staff fail to have a healthy mental wellness which affects and decreases work productivity, work efficiency, increase the cases of being burn-out, low job satisfaction and a surge in detrimental mental stress in the long run. Rationale This interactive, fun, reflective workshop takes the participants through the fastest and easiest steps to regain control of their life, have good mental health and reduce harmful stress. Simultaneously work-life balance will impact various aspects of the participants life positively. Through input, discussion, interactive activities and an online game, the participants will discover how to set up practical action plans to help them strike a balance between work and leisure. Please note this is not a complete, lengthy, and comprehensive mental wellness and stress management workshop. This is only a 1-day intensified workshop designed to provide the participants important core principles on resilience, self-emotional management, handling stress during these VUCA post pandemic era and to give them solid, practical, and actionable tips they can implement immediately. It specially formulated using the psychological methods of Neurolinguistics Programming and Neuro Associative Conditioning. However, to get optimal effectiveness, it is significantly recommended that participants go through a full 2-day workshop because the focus is on the development of each individual participant to have skills that can be used (know how) and not just a mere level of knowledge (know what).
methodology: This talk applies the adult learning (andragogy) method which involves all participants directly learning and applying the techniques involved. Participants engagement and interaction is crucial for this workshops success. As the focus is on skills training, the approach of the program is a practical one, i.e. Learning by Doing. This is a highly participative and interactive program using a variety of training techniques. Participants will have opportunities to practice with work related training material. The approaches used would include: Short Theories to reinforce the basics Liberal use of discussions to enhance understanding and confidence Individual and group exercises that are workplace oriented Video presentations Extensive use of training activities including exercises, quizzes, role-plays, and games that stimulate learning and participation The method of training and facilitation will be participants paced, participative and skills oriented. In addition to short Theories and discussions there will be individual and syndicate group exercises benefiting particularly from the cross exchange of personal experience and group dynamics.
learning_objectives: ["This workshop aims to:", "Be in charge of your mental well-being", "Instant applicable tips for reducing stress and feeling more relaxed", "Develop mindfulness", "Page 2", "Recognise the signs of an unbalanced life", "Learn to manage stress"]
learning_outcomes: ["After completing the workshop, participants will be able to:", "Examine their current work-life balance routines, activities and results achieved", "Reflect on obstacles in achieving balance, and discover ways of overcoming them", "Handle stress and emotions with effective techniques", "Evaluate your mental health status using the DAS scale"]

title: MENTAL WELLNESS: EMOTIONAL RESILIENCE
description: Program Rationale Due to the Covid-19 outbreak, Malaysia and almost 95% of countries around the world have been suddenly compelled to embrace remote working in maintaining social distancing and flattening the infection curve. Remote work comes with a wide variety of benefits, but it can also be a challenge if staff do not have a healthy mental wellness, this will affect and decrease productivity, work efficiency, increase cases of being burn-out, low job satisfaction and a surge in detrimental mental stress in the long run. This talk takes the participants through the fastest and easiest steps to regain control of their life, have good mental health and reduce harmful stress. Some stress is unavoidable, but we with correct techniques, it can be greatly reduced, and needless stress can be eliminated. We can even make stress work in our favour as well. By reducing stress levels, work and personal performance levels and happiness can be improved, too. Please note this is not a complete, lengthy, and comprehensive mental wellness and stress management workshop. This is only a one-day program designed to provide the participants important core principles on resilience, self-emotional management, handling stress during these VUCA post pandemic era and to give them solid, practical, and actionable tips they can implement immediately. It specially formulated using the psychological methods of Neurolinguistics Programming and Neuro Associative Conditioning. However, to get optimal effectiveness, it is significantly recommended that participants go through a full 2-day workshop because the focus is on the development of each individual participant to have skills that can be used (know how) and not just a mere level of knowledge (know what).
target_audience: For non-executives, executives, supervisors, managers, HR professionals or anyone in the organisation interested in acquiring more information, insights, and ease on good mental health in the workplace

This is a highly participative and interactive program using a variety of training techniques. Participants will have opportunities to practice with work related training material. The approaches used would include: Short Theories to reinforce the basics Liberal use of discussions to enhance understanding and confidence Individual and group exercises that are workplace oriented Video presentations Extensive use of training activities including exercises, quizzes, role-plays, and games that stimulate learning and participation The method of training and facilitation will be participants paced, participative and skills oriented. In addition to short Theories and discussions there will be individual and syndicate group exercises benefiting particularly from the cross exchange of personal experience and group dynamics.

title: CONFRONTING SEXUAL & POWER HARASSMENT: Tools & Strategies to Create a Harassment-Free Workplace
description: In Malaysia, current statistics reveal that 1 in 3 women and 1 in 6 men have been sexually harassed in their lifetime. While many organizations are facing the problems of having 4 very distinct generations at the workplace; some even with 5; causes an astray of set of beliefs and values which is very different with the other. As a result, conflicts and different sexual preconceptions arise at the workplace. It relates to the unsolicited verbal and non-verbal advances such as grouping, touching, kisses and even phone or email messages. Harassment and abusive conduct cost employers billions of dollars each year in lawsuits, employee turnover and lost productivity.
target_audience: Non-managerial, First-line, middle management, senior management, and anyone that has the potential to encounter sexual harassment either in the workplace or during their daily life
methodology: As the focus is on skills training, the approach of the program is a practical one, i.e. Learning by Doing. This is a highly participative and interactive program using a variety of training techniques. Participants will have opportunities to practice with work related training material. The approaches used would include: Short Theories to reinforce the basics Liberal use of discussions to enhance understanding and confidence Individual and group exercises that are workplace oriented Video presentations Extensive use of training activities including exercises, quizzes, role-plays, and games that stimulate learning and participation The method of training and facilitation will be participants paced, participative and skills oriented. In addition to short Theories and discussions there will be individual and syndicate group exercises benefiting particularly from the cross exchange of personal experience and group dynamics.
learning_objectives: ["This program aims to:", "Create awareness of organization s Anti-Harassment Policy", "Page 2", "Expose various types of sexual harassment", "Assist participants in handling sexual harassment through legitimate and self-defence", "techniques", "Reduce the risk of harassment claims", "Motivate participants to recognize, report and prevent misconduct", "Help create a respectful, inclusive workplace culture"]
learning_outcomes: ["After completing this program, participants should be able to:", "Become aware, understand, and adopt the company s Anti-Harassment Policy", "Identify sexual harassment behaviour and take steps to prevent it", "Create sexual harassment awareness in the workforce", "Deal with complaints of sexual harassment", "Protect themselves with simple defence skills when deemed necessary"]

title: ATTITUDE, BEHAVIOUR & CHANGE FOR ESG POLICY
description: In today's evolving corporate landscape, sustainability is no longer a choice but a necessity. According to Malaysias 12th Plan (2021-2025), the country is pushing forward with stringent ESG policies, with over 80% of Bursa-listed companies expected to integrate sustainability reporting by 2025. Globally, the EU Green Deal and the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are driving industries toward responsible practices. Sales and finance executives play a pivotal role in shaping ethical, responsible, and sustainable business decisions. This program provides participants with the fundamental awareness of attitudes, behaviours, and change management required to uphold ESG values, incorporating sustainable business ethics, anti- corruption policies, green corporate practices, and social responsibility. By attending this workshop, participants will gain hands-on experience in practical application of these principles within their organization. Program Rationale Corporate sustainability and ethical governance demand a shift in attitudes and behaviours toward accountability, transparency, and responsible business conduct. This workshop focuses on bridging the gap between knowledge and implementation, ensuring that executives adopt a mindset aligned with ESG compliance and sustainable business practices Program Value Proposition This workshop equips participants with the awareness, mindset shift, and skill set necessary to embed ESG principles into their daily operations. They will learn how to align their business strategies with green practices, uphold ethical business conduct, and integrate compliance measures such as zero bribery and harassment prevention within the corporate framework
target_audience: For executives and middle management interested in acquiring more information, insights, and seeking to integrate sustainability and ethical governance into their work
methodology: As the focus is on skills training, the approach of the program is a practical one, i.e. Learning by Doing. This is a highly participative and interactive program using a variety of training techniques. Participants will have ample opportunities to practice with work related training material. The workshop follows a highly interactive format using: Experiential Learning Activities (70%): Role plays, case studies, best practices discussions, experiential simulation, scenario-based ethical dilemmas, inter-group challenges and action learning projects Hands-on strategies for implementing green practices in corporate settings Practical skills to mitigate bribery, harassment, and unethical business conduct A roadmap to drive organizational change toward sustainability All sessions will be conducted via practical theories and applications, activities, games-based training, open dialogue, group discussions, PowerPoint presentation, Question and Answer slots which will be administered throughout the 2-days to reinforce lessons. Debriefs and application of lessons occur in real-time and result in a clear understanding of their behaviour and experience. It will support participants to create action steps to correct missteps in their results once they leave the training.
prerequisite: Pre & post-assessment questionnaire (to gauge techniques efficiency) Open mindset toward change and ESG adaptation Pre-reading on company sustainability policies

title: CORPORATE ESG & SUSTAINABILITY FOR LEADERS
description: In todays rapidly evolving business landscape, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) integration is no longer an option but a necessity. Global ESG investments surged to $30 trillion in 2022, with a sustainable financing market expected to grow by 24% annually until 2030. Regulatory frameworks are also tightening, with the European Unions Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and Malaysias Bursa Sustainability Reporting Requirements mandating greater transparency. In Malaysia, 76% of institutional investors prioritize ESG factors in decision-making, emphasizing the critical need for corporate ESG compliance For Perak Corporation Berhad, ESG is not just about compliance it is about business resilience, reputation management, and long-term profitability. This program is tailored for the top management team to provide a comprehensive understanding of ESG strategies, compliance frameworks, and sustainability leadership. The workshop will bridge the gap between corporate sustainability commitments and real-world execution, ensuring that participants can embed ESG into strategic decision-making and corporate governance. Program Rationale This program is designed to equip senior leaders with a practical and strategic approach to ESG implementation. By focusing on governance, reporting, risk management, and stakeholder engagement, the workshop ensures that ESG is integrated into corporate strategy, operations, and leadership decisions. Through a hands-on, immersive experience, participants will develop the skills needed to drive sustainability transformation at Perak Corporation Berhad Program Value Proposition This workshop delivers: Strategic ESG Leadership Ensuring top management aligns ESG goals with business objectives Compliance & Risk Mitigation Addressing Bursa Malaysias sustainability reporting and global ESG frameworks 0105 Stakeholder Trust & Investor Confidence Strengthening corporate reputation and financial sustainability Practical, Actionable ESG Skills Ensuring that leaders walk away with implementation-ready strategies

title: EQ & IQ AT THE WORKPLACE
description: In today's dynamic workplace, the integration of Emotional Intelligence (EQ) and Intelligence Quotient (IQ) is pivotal for organizational success. A recent study focusing on Malaysian employees highlighted that the COVID-19 pandemic adversely affected their emotional intelligence, leading to diminished job performance. Globally, there has been a consistent decline in emotional intelligence and well-being scores over the past four years, indicating a broader challenge in maintaining effective workplace dynamics. This two-day program is designed to enhance participants' EQ and IQ, providing a balanced mix of theoretical knowledge and practical skill development. By engaging in this program, participants will gain insights into their cognitive and emotional processes, leading to improved interpersonal relationships, decision-making, and overall job performance.
target_audience: Tailored for general staff across various departments who seek to improve their cognitive and emotional skills to enhance workplace performance
methodology: Physical workshop with 8 hours per day = 16 hours Day 1: Focus on Understanding and Harnessing Emotional & Cognitive Intelligence Day 2: Focus on Applying EQ & IQ for Workplace Success This workshop follows a 70:30 experiential-to-theoretical learning approach, ensuring active participation and hands-on skill development. The methodology includes: 0105 a) Interactive Lectures & Discussions: Short, high-impact theoretical sessions to introduce key concepts, frameworks, and best practices b) Live Demonstrations & Role-Playing: Real-world business scenarios where participants get to practice the techniques and tools learnt c) Case Studies & Group Exercises: Analysing real case analyses to identify best practices and areas for improvement d) Peer & Trainer Feedback: Personalized guidance through structured feedback on exercises Assessment i. A Pre- and Post-Training Test will be provided before the workshop commences and at the end of the workshop ii. MCQ questions via an online platform will be specifically designed to evaluate the participants realization of the programme iii. This is also to gauge the participants level of competency upon workshop completion

title: MENTAL HEALTH AWARENESS: EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL RESILIENCE
description: The COVID-19 pandemic has enormously affected the psychological well-being, social and working life of millions of people across the globe. The stigma of mental health is prevalent in Malaysia and according to the National Health and Morbidity Survey in 2019 report, half a million Malaysians were found to be experiencing symptoms of depression. Besides that, the onset of the pandemic has also led to an increase in cases of depression and anxiety. Ministry of Health (MOH) in 2021 has reported 85.5% of calls to government agencies since the pandemic were inquiring about mental health issues. Many of those calls required psychological and emotional support and counselling. MOH predicts that mental health is currently the 2nd highest health issue in Malaysia after heart disease. Challenges now arise when employed staff fail to have a healthy mental wellness which affects and decreases work productivity, work efficiency, increase the cases of being burn-out, low job satisfaction and a surge in detrimental mental stress in the long run. Rationale This interactive, fun, reflective workshop takes the participants through the fastest and easiest steps to regain control of their life, have good mental health and reduce harmful stress. Simultaneously work-life balance will impact various aspects of the participants life positively. Through input, discussion, interactive activities and an online game, the participants will discover how to set up practical action plans to help them strike a balance between work and leisure. Please note this is not a complete, lengthy, and comprehensive mental wellness and stress management workshop. This is only a 1-day intensified workshop designed to provide the participants important core principles on resilience, self-emotional management, handling stress during these VUCA post pandemic era and to give them solid, practical, and actionable tips they can implement immediately. It specially formulated using the psychological methods of Neurolinguistics Programming and Neuro Associative Conditioning. However, to get optimal effectiveness, it is significantly recommended that participants go through a full 2-day workshop because the focus is on the development of each individual participant to have skills that can be used (know how) and not just a mere level of knowledge (know what).
target_audience: For non-executives, executives and management in the organisation interested in acquiring more information, insights, and ease on good mental health in the workplace
methodology: This talk applies the adult learning (andragogy) method which involves all participants directly learning and applying the techniques involved. Participants engagement and interaction is crucial for this workshops success. As the focus is on skills training, the approach of the program is a practical one, i.e. Learning by Doing. This is a highly participative and interactive program using a variety of training techniques. Participants will have opportunities to practice with work related training material. The approaches used would include: Short Theories to reinforce the basics Liberal use of discussions to enhance understanding and confidence Individual and group exercises that are workplace oriented Video presentations Extensive use of training activities including exercises, quizzes, role-plays, and games that stimulate learning and participation The method of training and facilitation will be participants paced, participative and skills oriented. In addition to short Theories and discussions there will be individual and syndicate group exercises benefiting particularly from the cross exchange of personal experience and group dynamics.
learning_objectives: ["This workshop aims to:", "Be in charge of your mental well-being", "Instant applicable tips for reducing stress and feeling more relaxed", "Develop mindfulness", "Recognise the signs of an unbalanced life", "Learn to manage stress"]
learning_outcomes: ["After completing the workshop, participants will be able to:", "Examine their current work-life balance routines, activities and results achieved", "Reflect on obstacles in achieving balance, and discover ways of overcoming", "them", "Handle stress and emotions with effective techniques", "Evaluate your mental health status using the DAS scale"]

title: MINDSET CHANGE AND EFFECTIVE LEADERSHIP STYLES
description: As the workforce continues to evolve, strong executive leadership can propel businesses forward. In the face of uncertainty and volatility, businesses need effective leaders at the helm to retain employees and drive organizational growth. Executive leaders have the agility and skills necessary to respond to challenges and identify strategic opportunities. So, what sets executive leaders apart? Strong and coherent leadership act as a catalyst to the agile team by empowering the team to reach their goals by facilitating agile thinking and improving team practices. By empowering executive leaders to adopt new mental models and behaviours, agile and coherent leaders can support their organizations to drive change and adapt well into this VUCA post-covid era.

title: STRESS & EMOTIONAL CONTROL MANAGEMENT
description: Stress is a person's physical, emotional, and mental response to any sudden changes or demands. It's not a disease. However, if the pressure load is high and occurs over a long period of time, this will be detrimental to our health. This post Covid-19 era clearly shows an increased stress and emotions of public and private sector workers due to Work From Home as well as other aspects of work. The National Health and Morbidity Survey in 2019 reported that half a million Malaysians were found to be experiencing symptoms of depression. Besides that, since the onset of the pandemic this led to an increase in cases of depression and anxiety. Too much on-going distress causes an almost continuous activation of the bodys stress response system. The overexposure to cortisol and other stress hormones can increase risk of obesity, insomnia, digestive problems, heart disease, depression, memory impairment, and physical illness. It is important to recognize when we are in DISTRESS. This fun, interactive and hands-on program will provide practical tips and techniques to help the participants recognize the stress triggers, achieve better results and health through the effective management of distress.
target_audience: First-line management, middle management, senior management, and anyone interested in managing stress and dealing with emotions
methodology: Face-to-face workshop Medium of Delivery: English and Bahasa Malaysia (Preference according to the Client) As the focus is on skills training, the approach of the program is a practical one, i.e. Learning by Doing. This is a highly participative and interactive program using a variety of training techniques. Participants will have opportunities to practice with work related training material. The approaches used would include: Short Theories to reinforce the basics Liberal use of discussions to enhance understanding and confidence Individual and group exercises that are workplace oriented Video presentations Extensive use of training activities including exercises, quizzes, role-plays, and games that stimulate learning and participation The method of training and facilitation will be participants paced, participative and skills oriented. In addition to short Theories and discussions there will be individual and syndicate group exercises benefiting particularly from the cross exchange of personal experience and group dynamics.

learning_outcomes: ["After completing this training, participants should be able to:", "Understand the basic principles of stress management", "Recognize stress triggers and how to manage them", "Develop proactive responses to stressful situations", "Use coping tips for managing stress both on and off the job", "Develop a long-term action plan to minimize and better manage stress"]

These groups share a common purpose, see value in the contributions and abilities of each member of the team, speak frankly, seek out and address conflict, and look for ways to improve the status quo. This sounds fantastic, but getting out of a silo structure or changing a culture that does not reward collaboration is challenging.

title: STAFF MANAGEMENT AND DEVELOPMENT
description: Being a coach involves being able to draw from several disciplines. Many leaders turn to their mentors or coaches for support throughout their career, eager to learn more and leverage expert knowledge. Coaching is an invaluable tool for any leader or manager. Its a key process for inspiring employees to perform discretionary effort, which is the amount of effort someone is capable of delivering beyond the bare minimum. Mentorship is a related skill that is often a part of coaching. Its about being a guide, offering wisdom and advice when it is needed. Understanding the true nature of coaching and mentoring allows us to empower and inspire our employees. It allows us to create leaders at all levels who drive next-level performance. Coaching and mentoring need to offer structured solutions that assist their staff gradually overcome their impediments and achieve SMART (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic and Timely) goals. It is a long and patient process. Above all, managers need to remember that rapport is built through mutual respect

title: CREATIVE CRITICAL THINKING & PROBLEM SOLVING
description: Todays business especially this post Covid-19 endemic era thrives on uncertainty and dealing with complex problems becomes a norm rather than an exception. To equip individuals with the necessary skills to resolve problems and make decisions they must be trained to be problem solvers using critical thinking techniques. Problem-solving and critical thinking refers to the ability to use knowledge, facts, and data to solve problems effectively. The ability to develop a well thought out solution within a reasonable time frame, however, is a skill that employers value greatly. This module focuses on advanced skills and techniques to promote critical thinking. In addition, the participants would identify issues during handling critical thinking.

title: CHANGE AGENT FOUNDATION
description: According to data obtained from Kotter, McKinsey, and the Standish Group; the percentage of organisational change initiatives that are successful is around 30%. This is surprisingly low, considering the constant and accelerated need to incorporate changes in companies in the 21st century, where uncertainty, variability, and complexity are normal. In addition to the current post pandemic era, VUCA change agents who are agile, and fluid are essential to lead change internally. Indeed, this innovative, flexible, and adaptable way of doing things and ordering work has been credited by leading business leaders for its value as a methodology that can help them drive organisational change and face the VUCA world.

title: FLEXIBILITY & AGILITY IN CHANGE MANAGEMENT
description: Change can be hard. Change is also inevitable and necessary. In order to successfully grow as a company, a team, or an individual, we must be able to adapt to change and persevere through the good, the bad, and the ugly. Change is a dynamic, potent force that unfurls its true potential only when every involved individual is prepared and eager to adopt new practices. Managing the physical aspects of implementing change is just one part of the complex process; an equally crucial element is the ability to identify and handle the emotional impact that change inevitably ignites. Guiding people along this often challenging journey allows them to experience personal growth, in turn facilitating the effectiveness of organizational transformation
target_audience: Designed for employees who want to increase their personal change agility in the face of workplace and personal change and managers who want the tools to guide their employees when dealing with changing circumstances affected with the crucial insight needed to successfully manage change, small or large and continue staying relevant, agile and flexible

In addition to short lectures and discussions there will be individual and syndicate group exercises benefiting particularly from the cross exchange of personal experience and group dynamics.

title: Positive Work Culture
description: In today's fast-paced and competitive environment, the ability to navigate challenges, foster a positive mindset, and excel as an individual and team member has never been more crucial. "Developing a Positive You" is crafted to address these needs, providing participants with actionable strategies and practical skills that transcend conventional self-help approaches. This is a transformative course designed to unlock their potential and elevate their performance in both personal and professional spheres. In this dynamic program, we will delve into the crucial elements that contribute to personal development, fostering a positive mindset, and achieving high performance. Understanding ones life purpose, defining core values and passions, and overcoming common barriers to self-discovery will lay the foundation for personal growth. The course will help participants uncover the immense power of their thoughts and its direct impact on their outcomes. Explore the dichotomy between a fixed mindset and a growth mindset, activating the latter through conscious choices. Dive into the subconscious mind, challenge self-limiting beliefs, and develop a positive mental attitude. Participants will learn to transform their perspective on work and its profound influence on personal well-being. Explore the symbiotic relationship between work ethics and personal success, and unpack the renowned "7 Habits of Highly Effective People" by Stephen Covey. Discover the five essential ingredients of a high-performing team and understand how they contribute to organizational success. Participants will reflect on their personal contribution to the bigger picture, foster commitment, and create an action plan for continuous self-improvement
target_audience: Operators, General Workers, Downline employees
methodology: Highly interactive lectures, collaborative team-based activities, Games, Videos, Personal Reflections, Group discussions and sharing.
learning_objectives: ["Learn to embrace positive habits that contribute to personal and professional success", "Cultivate a leadership mindset focused on the growth and success of self and others", "Employ strategies for overcoming self-limiting beliefs and fostering a positive mental attitude", "Examine the impact of work ethics on personal life", "Apply the principles of Steven Covey's \"7 Habits of Highly Effective People\" to enhance personal and", "professional effectiveness", "Improve contribution to the team and organisation as a whole by applying the high-performance team culture"]

title: Work Ethics - Ignite Your Journey
description: Welcome to a revolutionary expedition tailored exclusively for the heartbeat of the hospitality industry! In the bustling corridors of hotels, where every interaction shapes an experience, and every guest carries a story, "Ignite Your Journey" emerges as the compass guiding hotel employees towards unparalleled personal and professional triumphs. In the symphony of service, where the echoes of guest satisfaction harmonize with the rhythms of relentless effort, the need for personal and professional mastery has never been more pressing. "Ignite Your Journey" is not merely a training; it is a dynamic odyssey meticulously crafted to resonate with the pulse of hotel employees, those extraordinary individuals who infuse life into the corridors, rooms, and lobbies of the hospitality haven. This transformative program is designed to equip hotel employees with the keys to unlock their fullest potential and elevate their performance within the vibrant tapestry of the hotel industry. As we navigate the labyrinth of challenges and opportunities unique to the realm of hospitality, "Ignite Your Journey" becomes the beacon illuminating the path towards personal growth, positive mindsets, and the zenith of high performance.
target_audience: Crafted exclusively for individuals in the hotel industry.

title: Sexual Harassment
description: Sexual harassment is pervasive in the workplace and it affects men and women of all ages. It is the responsibility of everyone to do the right thing when it comes to professional conduct in the workplace. Not just because we have to by law, but because everybody has the right to be treated fairly and with respect. That is the spirit of implementing a sexual harassment policy in the organisation. A recent survey conducted on 1,002 Malaysians concluded that 36% of women and 17% of men have experienced sexual harassment. From this, only 53% of victims reported or told someone about their harassment. The main worry not reporting sexual harassment is humiliation (54%), feeling alone and helpless (38%) and fear of consequences (26%). Companies need to consider the potential ramifications that can come from an employee sexually harassing another employee. Not only does this lead to a toxic culture and injury to reputation of the organisation, it can also result in loss of talents in the organisation and cause serious trauma to victims that could lead to mental health issues. It is important for organisations to have a robust sexual harassment policy including strong reporting mechanisms and prevention policy. On the other hand, employees need to know how to handle a situation if they are being harassed or seeing someone being harassed and be clear on the organisations policy, feel safe and confident in using the organisations reporting mechanism. This training session will educate employees on what is considered sexual harassment and teaches what kind of behavior is appropriate and expected in the workplace. The course will share the different legislations that apply to sexual harassment and help participants understand the topic on a wider context. It can be targeted and customised for managerial and supervisorial and non-executive level employees respectively.
target_audience: Executives, General Employees
methodology: Lecture, Videos, Group Discussion, Games, Case Studies
learning_objectives: ["Learning the definition of sexual harassment", "Understanding the impacts of sexual harassment on the organisation", "Learning applicable laws and offences covered under various local legislations", "Learn what is non-acceptable behavior", "Learn how to report sexual harassment cases"]
learning_outcomes: ["By the end of the training program, participants will be able to understand what is sexual harassment,", "the offences under the law and what amounts to unacceptable behaviour in the work place. Participants will also come to understand", "the need to treat others with utmost respect and sensitivity."]

title: STANDING OUT AGAINST THE TIDE - UPHOLDING GOOD CORPORATEGOVERNANCE AND ANTI- BRIBERY STANDARDS
description: While best practices are established to promote good governance and prevent bribery within corporate organizations, their efficacy hinges upon the awareness and training of employees and management. Corporate governance and anti-bribery training becomes indispensable. It is imperative that organisations are actively engaged in comprehensive training, enabling them to grasp the significance of ethical conduct and make personal commitments towards it. This training addresses Malaysia's prevailing corruption landscape in the public and private sector, its connection and the adverse effects on the economy and businesses, and empowers participants to actively uphold best practices. Through the examination of case studies and examples, participants are exposed to good governance standards and corruption risks, equipped with key strategies, and instilled with the requisite methods to uphold exemplary governance standards in their roles. This training underscores the importance of maintaining integrity in one's professional conduct and cultivates a culture of ethical values among employees and management teams
target_audience: Management Team, Executives, Managers, Directors, Compliance Teams

title: COMMUNICATING AND NETWORKING IN A STRESSFUL ENVIRONMENT BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS AND ACCOMPLISHING GOALS THROUGH PROPER COMMUNICATION TECHNIQUES
description: Rarely do we give much thought to normal everyday conversations. But sometimes we find ourselves in situations where we wish we could present ourselves more clearly and our ideas more persuasively. Communicating in a stressful environment such as in the healthcare industry is even more challenging especially when we are trying to communicate across departments and different teams and trying to meet patient satisfaction and needs. In such situations. applying proper communication techniques is key to improving relationships between departments, teams and co-workers and can help increase work performance, productivity and meet customer expectations. Do words, voice, and body language convey a consistent and strong message? How can we defuse conflicts and find common solutions? How can we network and grow strong relationships across departments and teams? What is our common purpose here? How do I contribute to the larger picture? These are some of the important questions that would be discussed in this training. This course would enable participants to harness the power of communication and adopt behavioural changes to improve their performance and team work attitude. Participants will learn and practice the foundations of persuasive communication. Get to know the communication process, planning and tips for success. Participants will learn how to make their message clear and how to meet communication objectives, build relationships and networks within the Hospital.
target_audience: Personals in the Healthcare Industry
methodology: Highly Interactive Lecture, Videos, Group Discussion, Games, Case Studies, Personal Reflection.
learning_objectives: ["Assess key principles of effective communication skills in the healthcare provider environment", "Improve personal communication skills and strategies", "Learn how to influence others and lead change with action", "Improve relationship with team members, departments and build networks", "Learn how to uplift own capabilities, knowledge and strength."]

title: CUSTOMER SERVICE COMMUNUCATION
description: In today's dynamic business environment, effective communication is the cornerstone of outstanding customer service. Whether you're dealing with a query over the phone, responding to an email, or engaging in face-to-face interactions, the way we communicate shapes the perception our customers have of our organization. Over the next two days, we will dive deep into various aspects of communication, from understanding customer needs to mastering both verbal and written communication skills. We'll explore practical strategies, share insights, and engage in hands-on activities to ensure that the principles we discuss are not only understood but applied in real-world scenarios. Our goal is to empower each one of you with the tools and techniques needed to create positive and lasting impressions, even in challenging situations. Whether you're a seasoned customer service professional or just starting in this role, there's always room for improvement, and this training is designed to cater to all levels of expertise.

title: Decision - Making Workshop
description: Throughout this one-day workshop, we will delve into the fundamental principles, models, and techniques of decision-making, equipping you with the tools and strategies needed to make informed, effective, and timely decisions. Whether you're a seasoned leader, a budding entrepreneur, or an individual contributor seeking to enhance your decision-making process, this workshop is tailored to meet your needs. In today's fast-paced and dynamic environment, the ability to make sound decisions under pressure is a valuable asset. Every decision we make big or small shapes our future, influences outcomes, and impacts those around us. Therefore, it's crucial to understand the intricacies of decision-making, recognize potential pitfalls, and adopt proven methodologies to navigate through them. Throughout our time together, we'll explore various topics, including the psychology of decision-making, different decision-making models, techniques for overcoming biases, and practical tools for analyzing alternatives. Through interactive discussions, case studies, group activities, and real-world examples, we'll immerse ourselves in the world of decision-making, fostering a collaborative learning environment where insights are shared, perspectives are challenged, and growth is nurtured.
target_audience: Managers and Leaders: Supervisors and Team Leaders
methodology: Lecture/Discussion Case Studies Group Activities: Interactive Exercises
learning_outcomes: ["Understand the importance of effective decision-making and its impact on individual and organizational success.", "Recognize different types of decisions and the factors influencing decision-making processes.", "Explain various decision-making models and apply them to real-life scenarios.", "Identify common cognitive biases that affect decision-making and employ strategies to mitigate their influence.", "Follow a structured decision-making process, including problem identification, alternative generation, evaluation, and implementation.", "Utilize decision-making tools and creative problem-solving techniques to generate and evaluate alternatives.", "Assess risks associated with decision-making and develop strategies to manage uncertainty.", "Recognize the importance of communication and stakeholder management in decision-making processes.", "Apply learned concepts and techniques to make more informed and effective decisions in their personal and professional lives.", "Develop an action plan for implementing decision-making skills in their work context and continuously improve their", "decision-making abilities."]

title: MANAGEMENT SKILLS DEVELOPMENT
description: Leadership in the workplace refers to the ability of an individual to manage and/or supervise subordinates. It also refers to the ability to positively influence others to perform their jobs to the best of their ability which will result in the success for the organisation. Effective leaders will lead their team and that will be more likely to impact the decisions, actions, and overall attitude of others in a positive manner. When there is good morale and a positive working environment, the company is set up for success. However, to be an effective leader, it is important to note why do certain people react the way they do? How do I inspire people that is different from me? Why do people think the way they do? What are the motivation factors of people and how to identify them? Leadership today is very different from leadership in the past. Hence understanding who you are working with will tell you the right tools to lead the team. This program takes you through to understand people around you and how to manage / lead them effectively.
target_audience: Executives Management teams Frontline staff Supervisory staff
methodology: Training is delivered in a highly interactive and experiential way. Concepts and background information are presented through group exercises, discussion and activities creating an environment that facilitates accelerated learning and application. The trainer will facilitate discussion of real issues and challenges that the participants face in their work and private lives. Each activity will be thoroughly de-briefed to link the learning to real life situations. At the end of the program, participants will be provided with an assignment that they will be required to discuss within their groups and present during the Action Learning session (2 weeks after the program).

The 1 day program is designed for anyone who deals with customers on a day-to-day basis at work to deliver excellence in customer service. title: Excellence in Hotel Customer Service
description: This comprehensive 2-day training program is tailored for front-line staff in the hotel industry, equipping them with essential skills in time management and discipline. The course aims to elevate customer service standards by focusing on efficient task prioritization, effective communication, and cultivating a disciplined approach to work. Through a combination of interactive sessions, role- playing scenarios, and practical exercises, participants will gain the expertise needed to provide exceptional service in a hotel setting.

methodology: The course employs a dynamic and participatory approach, incorporating a variety of instructional methods to cater to different learning styles: Interactive Lectures: Engaging presentations covering time management principles and disciplined work habits. Role-playing Scenarios: Real-life simulations of common hotel customer service situations for immediate application of skills. Feedback and improvement strategies for personalized development. Group Discussions: Facilitated discussions on challenges faced in time management and maintaining discipline. Sharing best practices and learning from peers. Case Studies: Analyzing real-world case studies to understand the impact of effective time management and disciplined work. title: NEGOTIATION SKILLS
description: Are you overlooked in meetings? Do your colleagues consistently ignore your ideas? Do you struggle to convert prospects to clients? title: 4X4 DEFENSIVE TRAINING
description: This course is designed to empower participants with the essential skills and knowledge to drive safely and confidently in all types of terrain. Over the next two days, we will cover key techniques for handling 4x4 vehicle in challenging conditions, such as hill ascents and descents, water crossings, and uneven surfaces. Participants will also gain a deeper understanding of the 4WD system, learn to recognize common driving errors, and improve their ability to react effectively in emergencies, including how to safely perform vehicle recovery using a winch and high-lift jack. By the end of the course, participants will be equipped with both the theoretical and practical skills to navigate off- road situations with confidence, ensuring driver safety and the longevity of the vehicle. Lets get started on this exciting journey to becoming a safer, more skilled 4x4 driver

title: Employment Act 1955
description: Employment Act (1955) also known as EA, its an act the outline the rights of employees and employers under the law. Human Resource Personnels have to play significant role in ensuring organizations comply with the various sections under EA. It is mandatory to comply with various pertinent acts to ensure a fair workplace to avoid lawsuits. This training will cover all the scope of the Act and the latest amendments to give participants an overview of the act.

methodology: Interactive lecture Group discussion Presentation Role Play Game (Only applicable to physical class)

title: KEMAHIRAN BERKOMUNIKASI DALAM BAHASA MELAYU
description: Program Kemahiran Komunikasi memberi tumpuan kepada bercakap dan menulis dalam Bahasa Melayu. Program bercakap dan menulis yang komprehensif ini merangkumi asas komunikasi, penulisan modular,dan cara mengatur maklumat untuk komunikasi perniagaan yang cekap dan berkesan. Ia merupakan cara yang mudah dan teratur untuk menghasilkan satu tulisan yang baik.
target_audience: Bukan Eksekutif Eksekutif Pihak Pengurusan
methodology: Program ini sangat praktikal dengan minimum teori dan maksimum latihan. Falsafah pengajaran berpaksikan pembelajaran berpengalaman dan peserta digalakkan untuk menggunakan contoh dari kerja mereka. Saiz kelas dikekalkan kecil untuk membolehkan perhatian individu dan pembimbingan peribadi peserta. Latihan disampaikan secara interaktif melalui latihan berkumpulan, perbincangan, dan aktiviti yang mencipta persekitaran yang memudahkan pembelajaran dan aplikasi yang cepat
