title: Consultative Selling: Building Trust and Driving Results
description: In Consultative Selling, every sales professional must be equipped with the essential skills and framework that specifically tailored for channel sales and distribution environments. Unlike traditional transactional selling, consultative selling focuses on building trust, understanding customer needs, and offering tailored solutions that drive long-term partnerships. Practical approach on the 5-step consultative selling process are important to address challenges faced by business partner [distributors/reseller/agents] in generating better sales results to end user [customer]. At the same time, it is also about practicing a compelling value proposition, handling objections, and positioning products as business solutions rather than mere commodities.
target_audience: Executive level and above in Selling and Consulting
methodology: On the spot coaching session for immediate feedback and improvement Group Discussion and Presentation Interactive Session & Role Play Activities Video Learning
learning_objectives: ["Equip sales professionals with consultative selling skills to build stronger relationships, understand customer needs, and drive sustainable sales growth in channel and distribution environments.", "Shifing from a push-based approach to a consultative mindset, fostering stronger relationships and sustainable revenue growth in channel sales.", "Practical action plan to implement consultative selling techniques, enhancing the ability to influence decisions and drive mutual success with partners"]

title: Customer Experience for Service Excellence
description: Customers have many choices! If they are happy with the way they are treated, they will stay with you. With the fast changing of technologies and trend in todays global economy, providing better customer service is compulsory and necessity. All of us are doing that. At the same time, are we doing our best in an amazing way? Customers may first come into your business because of your product and/or service, and they will decide to come again based on how well they are treated. That is where we move beyond service in giving a better experience by having them as our customer. Moving beyond service from reactive to proactive in providing better customer experience is the key to service excellence.

title: Leadership in Action - for Managers and Supervisors
description: Leading others can be a tough job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other in their development, your day can fill up before you know it. Leadership in Action will help Managers and Supervisors become more efficient and proficient, with information on delegating, managing time, setting goals and expectations (for themselves and others), providing feedback, resolving conflict, and administering discipline.

title: Experiential Selling Skills in Retail
description: Retail industry is fast moving and changing all the time. Selling and generating profit is important for every organization. Managing customer expectation is everyone task in a retail outlet. It is also to ensure every staff are well equip with the right sales mindset to achieve and exceed the sales target. Challenges in selling are part of the process and it is all about having the right mindset to overcome it. As long as you are prepare and fully practicing the skills and knowledge, you are just there for the customer in helping them to enjoy a wonderful experience in your outlet.
target_audience: Sales Executive and Advisor in Retail industry Anyone who is the in the sales industry Anyone who got to handle or manage customer expectation
methodology: Group Discussion and Presentation Interactive Session Activities Video Learning

title: HUMAN RESOURCE POLICIES AND STAFF HANDBOOK
description: Human Resource (HR) policies and the Staff Handbook are essential tools for managing employees and ensuring a smooth, organized workplace. These documents outline the rules, expectations, and rights of both employees and the organization.
target_audience: HR Managers and HR Professionals Supervisors and Team Leaders Line Managers Business Owners and Entrepreneurs Employees
methodology: Methodology: Lectures/Presentations: Provide an overview of key HR policies and the structure of the staff handbook through clear, informative presentations. Group Discussions: Engage participants in discussions about the importance of HR policies and how they impact workplace culture and compliance. Case Studies: Present real-life scenarios that highlight the application of HR policies and the staff handbook in resolving workplace issues. Role-Playing Exercises: Have participants practice handling employee concerns or enforcing policies using role-play to develop practical skills. Interactive Q&A Sessions: Encourage participants to ask questions about policies, legal compliance, and the use of the handbook in various situations. Workshops/Hands-On Activities: Guide participants through creating or updating sections of a staff handbook to reinforce understanding. Quizzes or Assessments: Use quizzes to test participants knowledge and retention of key HR policies and procedures.
prerequisite: Basic Understanding of HR Functions: Participants should have a general knowledge of human resource management and its role in an organization. Familiarity with Workplace Policies: It is helpful for participants to be familiar with basic workplace policies such as attendance, leave, and employee conduct. Awareness of Employment Laws: A basic understanding of relevant labor laws and regulations, especially in the context of the specific country, is beneficial. Current Role Involvement: Participants should be in, or aspiring to be in, roles related to HR, management, or supervisory functions where HR policies are relevant.
learning_objectives: ["Understand the purpose and importance of HR policies in an organization.", "Recognize how HR policies ensure legal compliance and fairness in the workplace.", "Learn the key components of a staff handbook and its role in communicating company policies.", "Identify how the staff handbook supports employee onboarding and day-to-day operations.", "Know how to use HR policies and the staff handbook to resolve workplace issues."]
learning_outcomes: ["Ability to explain the purpose and benefits of HR policies within an organization.", "Confidence in applying HR policies to ensure legal compliance and consistency in the workplace.", "Familiarity with the structure and content of a staff handbook.", "Competence in using the staff handbook to guide employees on workplace expectations and", "procedures.", "Capability to resolve common workplace issues by referring to relevant HR policies and the staff", "handbook."]

title: MEMAHAMI ASAS INDUSTRIAL RELATIONS DAN EMPLOYEERELATIONS DI TEMPAT KERJA
CRISIS READY: COMMUNICATE, RESPOND, AND REBUILD
description: In todays fast-paced world, crises can emerge suddenly, threatening an organizations reputation, operations, and stakeholder trust. Effective communication is crucial for minimizing damage and ensuring recovery. Strong media relations are equally vital, as the media plays a key role in sharing an organizations message during challenging times. This 2-day Crisis Communication Training equips participants with the skills, tools, and strategies to handle crises and engage effectively with the media. Combining theoretical insights and practical exercises, it teaches participants to anticipate crises, craft messages, and interact with journalists and stakeholders. With hands-on activities like role-playing, mock interviews, and case studies, participants will develop the confidence and expertise needed to manage public relations issues, address stakeholders, and protect their organizations reputation.
target_audience: Corporate communication / public relations professionals Crisis management teams Media spokespersons Senior management responsible for organizational communication
methodology: Interactive Lectures: Foundational theories and best practices in crisis communication and media relations. Case Studies: Real-world examples to analyze successful and failed crisis responses. Group Discussions: Collaborative sessions to brainstorm solutions to hypothetical scenarios. Role-Playing Exercises: Simulated media interviews and press conferences for practical exposure. Video Analysis: Review of effective and ineffective crisis communication tactics. Feedback Sessions: Constructive critiques to refine participants' communication skills.
prerequisite: Basic knowledge of organizational communication principles. Familiarity with the organizations mission, values, and key stakeholders. Willingness to actively participate in role-playing and group activities.
learning_objectives: ["Equip participants with the knowledge and skills to manage communication during a crisis", "effectively.", "Build confidence in engaging with the media during high-pressure situations.", "Develop strategies to protect and enhance the organization s reputation during a crisis.", "Foster an understanding of the importance of timely, transparent, and consistent", "communication."]
learning_outcomes: ["By the end of the training, participants will be able to:", "Identify and analyze potential crises and their impact on organizational reputation.", "Develop a crisis communication plan tailored to their organization.", "Craft effective key messages for stakeholders and the media.", "Execute media relations strategies during a crisis.", "Conduct themselves confidently during press conferences and interviews."]

title: STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS AND STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT FOR BUSINESS SUCCESS
description: Welcome to the Strategic Communication and Stakeholder Engagement for Business Success training. This two-day program is designed to help professionals strengthen their communication skills and build effective relationships with key stakeholders. In todays fast-paced business environment, strong communication and stakeholder engagement are essential for achieving organizational goals, managing crises, and building trust. Whether working on internal initiatives or external partnerships, knowing how to communicate strategically can make a big difference. Throughout this training, participants will learn how to create communication plans, identify and prioritize stakeholders, and handle communication during both stable and challenging times. Through interactive lectures, case studies, group discussions, and role-playing exercises, participants will gain practical experience and insights that can be applied directly to their roles.
target_audience: Mid to Senior-Level Managers responsible for strategic planning, external communication, or stakeholder coordination. Corporate Communications and PR Professionals involved in message development, media relations, and reputation management. Project and Program Managers who engage with multiple internal and external stakeholders throughout project lifecycles. CSR and Sustainability Officers focused on community engagement, partnership building, and sustainable stakeholder relationships. HR and Organizational Development Professionals involved in internal communications and employee engagement initiatives. Public Affairs and Government Relations Personnel who liaise with government bodies, regulators, and advocacy groups.
methodology: Interactive Lectures: Foundational theories and best practices in stakeholder engagement Case Studies: Real-world examples to analyze successful and failed crisis responses. Group Discussions: Collaborative sessions to brainstorm solutions to hypothetical scenarios. Role-Playing Exercises: Simulated media interviews and press conferences for practical exposure. Video Analysis: Review of effective and ineffective crisis communication tactics. Feedback Sessions: Constructive critiques to refine participants' communication skills.
prerequisite: Basic knowledge of organizational communication principles. Familiarity with the organizations mission, values, and key stakeholders. Willingness to actively participate in role-playing and group activities.
learning_objectives: ["Upon completion of this workshop, participants will be able to:", "Understand the principles and practices of strategic communication and how they", "contribute to achieving organizational goals.", "Identify, analyze, and prioritize stakeholders using proven tools and frameworks to tailor", "engagement strategies effectively.", "Develop and implement strategic communication and stakeholder engagement plans,", "including key messaging, channel selection, and evaluation methods.", "Enhance practical communication skills through role-playing, case studies, and", "feedback sessions, with a focus on crisis management and relationship-building."]

title: MALAYSIAN FOREIGN LABOR MANAGEMENT
description: This comprehensive training program on Malaysian Foreign Labor Management is designed to provide participants with a deep understanding of the regulations, processes, and best practices for effectively managing foreign workers in Malaysia. Through a combination of theoretical knowledge, case studies, practical exercises, and interactive discussions, participants will gain insights into compliance, cultural awareness, and effective management of foreign labor.
target_audience: Human Resources Professionals: HR Managers, Specialists, and Officers who handle the recruitment, onboarding, and management of foreign workers. Managers and Supervisors: Department heads and supervisors who oversee foreign workers and need to ensure their integration, well-being, and performance.
methodology: Interactive Workshops and Presentations Legal and Regulatory Review Case Studies and Real-Life Examples Group Discussions and Peer Learning
learning_objectives: ["Understand the regulatory framework for foreign labor management in Malaysia.", "Navigate the recruitment, hiring, and documentation processes for foreign workers.", "Comply with legal requirements, including work permits, visas, and contract terms.", "Foster a culturally sensitive and inclusive work environment.", "Manage foreign workers' rights, welfare, and well-being effectively.", "Address challenges and issues related to foreign labor management.", "Apply best practices to enhance foreign labor management and organizational success."]

title: PREVENTION & HANDLING OF SEXUAL HARASSMENT IN THE WORKPLACE
description: Creating a safe and respectful workplace is a key responsibility for all leaders and managers. With the introduction of the Anti-Sexual Harassment Act 2022 (ASHA 2022) and updates to the Employment Act 1955, organizations in Malaysia must now take stronger action to prevent and handle sexual harassment at work. These two laws work together ASHA 2022 provides a clear legal process through a dedicated tribunal, while the Employment Act requires employers to protect their employees from harassment. Sexual harassment can happen in many forms verbal, physical, online and often involves power imbalances, especially when managers, supervisors, or clients are involved. Thats why it is so important for leaders to understand their role, know how to respond fairly, and build a workplace culture that encourages respect and open communication.
target_audience: This program is designed for individuals in leadership and decision-making roles who are responsible for managing people, maintaining workplace culture, or handling misconduct issues. Participants will gain the legal, ethical, and practical tools to prevent and manage sexual harassment effectively. Target group: Department Heads & Senior Managers HR Personnel (All Level) Compliance & Legal Officers Supervisors & Team Leaders Employee Relations Officers Health & Safety Committee Members Line Managers responsible for employee well-being and conduct
methodology: Interactive Workshops and Presentations Legal and Regulatory Review Case Studies and Real-Life Examples Group Discussions and Peer Learning
learning_objectives: ["By the end of this training, participants will be able to:", "Define what constitutes sexual harassment and identify its forms in the workplace.", "Understand the key provisions of ASHA 2022 and the Employment Act 1955 related to", "sexual harassment.", "Recognize their responsibilities as leaders in preventing, responding to, and managing", "complaints.", "Apply fair procedures and empathetic communication when handling incidents.", "Develop and implement anti-harassment policies and awareness initiatives within their", "organizations."]

title: Strategic ESG: Driving Integrated Value & Performance
description: The Malaysian Imperative: Why This Course is Essential Now The landscape for sustainability reporting in Malaysia is rapidly evolving, shifting from a voluntary best practice to a strategic and increasingly mandatory imperative for both large corporations and Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs). This transformation is driven by a confluence of regulatory mandates, investor expectations, and the undeniable economic opportunities presented by the green economy. Mandatory Disclosure for Publicly Listed Companies (PLCs): Bursa Malaysia's enhanced sustainability reporting requirements, aligned with global standards like TCFD, are being phased in. Critically, Malaysia's National Sustainability Reporting Framework (NSRF) will mandate that the nation's largest publicly listed companies disclose their entire value chain's (Scope 3) greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions starting 2027. This directly impacts large corporations and, by extension, places significant pressure on their SME suppliers to provide robust sustainability data. (Source: Eco-Business, July 2025; Incorp.asia, June 2025) SMEs as a Critical Link: While direct mandatory reporting for all SMEs is not yet universal, they are increasingly under pressure from large corporate clients, financial institutions, and global supply chains. Recognizing this, Malaysia has been proactive, becoming the first country globally to issue a simplified ESG disclosure guide for SMEs in supply chains (Simplified ESG Disclosure Guide - SEDG, launched by Capital Markets Malaysia in 2023). This initiative, alongside SME Corp Malaysia's ESG Quick Guide for MSMEs, aims to build capacity and align SMEs with global frameworks. (Source: Capital Markets Malaysia, 2023; SME Corp Malaysia, Feb 2025) Economic Opportunity & Value Creation: Beyond compliance, embracing ESG offers tangible benefits for Malaysian businesses: Enhanced Financial Performance: Studies indicate a positive correlation between strong ESG practices and financial performance, including Return on Assets (ROA) and Return on Equity (ROE) for Malaysian firms. (Source: EconJournals.com, 2024) Increased Valuation & Investment: Companies with robust ESG focus are favorably positioned for higher valuations. For instance, companies in the FTSE4Good Bursa Malaysia (F4GBM) Index have traded at 1.7x higher in price-to-book value. Malaysia saw USD 5.2 billion in green investments in Southeast Asia in 2022, signaling growing investor appetite. (Source: PwC Malaysia, 2023) Risk Mitigation & Resilience: Proactive ESG integration helps companies identify and mitigate environmental, social, and governance risks, enhancing long-term corporate longevity and operational efficiency. (Source: Ajinomoto.com.my, 2024; IMD Business School, 2024) Supply Chain Competitiveness: For SMEs, ESG adoption is increasingly vital to remain competitive within global supply chains, with 80% of Malaysian SMEs now aware of ESG and 60% adopting it (up from 41% awareness in a prior survey). (Source: Alliance Bank Malaysia, ESG 2.0 Report, 2023) This course is therefore not merely an educational offering; it is a strategic imperative designed to equip your leadership team with the foresight and capabilities to navigate this evolving landscape, unlock new value streams, and secure your organization's future competitiveness in Malaysia and globally.
target_audience: This program is designed for a broad spectrum of professionals, from managers to C-suite executives, who are involved in or impacted by their organization's sustainability journey. This includes, but is not limited to, individuals from: Sustainability / ESG Teams: Heads of Sustainability, ESG Managers, Analysts. Finance: CFOs, Financial Controllers, Investment Relations, Treasury, Analysts. Strategy & Business Development: Chief Strategy Officers, Business Unit Heads, Strategic Planners. Risk Management & Legal: Chief Risk Officers, Compliance Officers, Legal Counsel. Procurement & Supply Chain: Chief Procurement Officers, Supply Chain Managers, Sourcing Specialists. Human Resources: Chief HR Officers, Talent Management, DEI Leaders. Business Operations: Chief Operating Officers, Operations Managers, Production Heads, Facility Managers. Marketing & Communications: Chief Marketing Officers, Brand Managers, Corporate Communications. IT & Data Analytics: CIOs, Data Scientists, IT Managers supporting ESG data. Any professional seeking to understand and contribute to their organization's strategic sustainability agenda and reporting efforts.
methodology: Interactive Presentations & Expert-Led Discussions: Leveraging the expertise of the trainer and encouraging peer-to-peer learning. Group Activities: Fostering collaborative problem-solving and knowledge sharing.
learning_objectives: ["To equip leaders and professionals across all functions with the strategic frameworks and", "collaborative capabilities to transform sustainability reporting from a compliance function", "into a powerful driver of enterprise value and sustainability performance."]

title: SUSTAINABILITY IN PRACTICE: MASTERING ESG FOR DRIVING BUSINESS PERFORMANCE AND RESILIENCE
description: Dive into the transformative world of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors with this dynamic course designed for todays forward-thinking business landscape. We emphasize the crucial role ESG plays not just in enhancing risk management and elevating corporate performance, but also in ensuring compliance with regulations and protecting your brands reputation. Join us as we build trust among stakeholders while exploring fundamental ESG concepts, alongside vital global and national regulations and reporting standards. Well tackle urgent ESG megatrends, navigate mandatory reporting requirements, and embrace the shift toward a low-carbon economy. Plus, discover how cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI) technology can amplify and accelerate your ESG initiatives. Equip yourself with the essential knowledge, tools, and frameworks needed to harmonize corporate objectives with sustainability goals, positioning your organization as a leader in responsible business practices. Your journey towards a more sustainable future starts here!
target_audience: Senior Directors and Directors Senior Accountants and Financial Controllers Senior ESG strategists and ESG Controllers Finance Manager and Account Executives Enterprise Risk Managers and Executives Professionals managing ESG functions at Corporations and SMEs
methodology: A highly interactive learning session with trainer/speaker-led facilitation, case studies and simulations, AI- driven tools and practical applications, group-based mini projects to solve ESG challenges, Q&As, quick polls/surveys, self-assessment quizzes, participant's feedback on learning outcome achievement, and post- course access to ESG updates and networks.
learning_objectives: ["By the end of this training, participants will be able to:", "Understand ESG principles and their integration into business strategies and the essentials of ESG from the", "Environment (E), Social (S) and Governance (G) factors and how ESG issues become financially material to", "corporations and their investors.", "Gain insights on integrating ESG principles into business by embedding them in strategic planning and", "corporate transactions, aligning corporate and sustainability goals, engaging heterogeneous stakeholders, and", "driving corporate transformative change.", "Explain key sustainability regulations (e.g., CSRD) and reporting frameworks (e.g., ISSB, NSRF) for meeting", "regulatory compliance and strengthening stakeholders trust. Learn techniques to evaluate companies using", "ESG criteria for informed investment decisions.", "Understand Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools and applications for ESG implementation. Discover how to leverage", "AI and digital tools to assess climate risks and enhance ESG data management, leading to more effective", "sustainability efforts.", "Analyse simulated ESG case dilemmas, make recommendations and integrating ESG into business practices.", "Learn ways to report risks and opportunities and boosts stakeholder confidence, attracts investments, and", "helps companies adapt to regulatory and market changes."]

title: Mastering Sustainability Reporting and Disclosures for Corporations and SMEs: Integrating ISSB Standards with National Regulatory Requirements
description: This two-day workshop offers an unparalleled opportunity for Malaysian PLCs and SMEs to understand and learn the intricacies of sustainability reporting. We'll focus on the practical application of the IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards (ISSB Standards) within Malaysia's unique regulatory context. Through a blend of expert instruction, interactive discussions, deep-dive sessions, and extensive case studies, participants will gain the confidence and practical skills needed to develop robust, compliant, and impactful sustainability reports. The program will cover not just the "what," but crucially, the "how-to," focusing on real- world implementation challenges, data management, and the integration of ESG into core business strategy, ensuring Malaysian PLCs are well-prepared for the current and future reporting landscape.
target_audience: This intensive two-day workshop is essential for accountants, financial and ESG controllers, sustainability managers, corporate planners, internal auditors, risk management professionals, and all key personnel within Malaysia's public-listed corporations (PLCs) who are responsible for or involved in ESG governance, strategy, risks, data collection, KPI-and-target setting, sustainability reporting, and assurance. This resource is specifically designed for individuals who are new to the ISSB IFRS S1 and S2 standards concerning climate-related and sustainability disclosures. It addresses the associated risks and opportunities in these fields while providing guidance on developing a plan to adapt internal management information systems in alignment with the new IFRS requirements. Additionally, it aims to enhance understanding of the evolving mandatory regulatory requirements set forth by Bursa Malaysia and the Securities Commission Malaysia.
methodology: This two-day workshop will maximize learning through: Interactive Presentations & Expert-Led Discussions: Leveraging the expertise of the trainer and encouraging peer-to-peer learning. Extensive Malaysian Case Studies: Analyzing real-world examples from Bursa Malaysia listed companies to illustrate practical application and challenges. In-Depth Hands-on Exercises: Participants will actively work on scenarios, materiality assessments, gap analyses, and data interpretation, solidifying their understanding. Group Activities & Breakout Sessions: Fostering collaborative problem-solving and knowledge sharing. Practical Templates and Checklists: Providing actionable tools for immediate application within their organizations. Q&A and Dedicated Consultation Time: Ensuring all specific questions and concerns are addressed.
learning_objectives: ["Upon completion of this workshop, participants will be able to:", "Understand and Navigate Regulatory Requirement: Identify global and industry-specific", "trends in sustainability, including regulatory changes and stakeholder expectations.", "Differentiate various sustainability reporting frameworks such as GRI, SASB, CDP, TCFD,", "TNFD, ISSB IFRS, EU CSRD, and US SEC. Gain a comprehensive understanding of", "Malaysia s evolving sustainability reporting landscape, including Bursa Malaysia s", "requirements and phased ISSB (IFRS S1 & S2) adoption under the National Sustainability", "Reporting Framework (NSRF).", "Apply ISSB Standards and Conduct Gap Analysis: Learn to implement ISSB-aligned", "reporting (IFRS S1 & S2) and perform gap analyses against existing frameworks such as", "GRI and TCFD to align with enhanced disclosure expectations.", "Strengthen ESG Data Management and Reporting Integrity: Develop practical skills in", "ESG data collection, GHG emissions reporting (Scope 1, 2, 3), materiality assessment,", "and establishing internal controls to ensure data quality and reporting reliability.", "Integrate Sustainability into Corporate Strategy: Formulate strategic roadmaps to", "embed sustainability reporting within corporate governance and decision-making", "processes, including climate scenario analysis and risk management. Learn the cross-", "functional collaboration among strategic planning, sustainability, enterprise risk", "management, finance, HSE corporate functions and business units, required to prepare", "the ISSB sustainability reporting.", "Prepare for External Assurance and Learn from Malaysian Case Studies: Prepare for", "external assurance requirements, e.g., ISSA 5000, for sustainability disclosures and", "draw insights from real-world reporting practices of Malaysian PLCs to enhance", "corporate and business readiness."]

title: IMPORT EXPORT DOCUMENTATION & PROCEDURE
description: Navigating import and export regulations can be complex, especially with evolving customs legislations, documentation requirements, and tax implications. This comprehensive course equips participants with a clear understanding of customs laws, procedures, and compliance requirements, covering key areas such as INCOTERMS 2020, prohibition orders, SST treatment, and post-importation audits. Through practical guidance on documentation, valuation, exemptions, and certificates of origin, participants will gain the skills to manage import/export operations efficiently and in compliance with regulatory standards. Designed for manufacturers, importers, exporters, trading houses, tax consultants, and practitioners, this program provides essential knowledge to streamline trade processes and minimize compliance risks.
target_audience: This course is suitable for all manufacturers, importers, exporters, trading houses, tax consultants and practitioners in understanding the complexity of customs procedures.
methodology: Interactive presentation
learning_objectives: ["By the end of this program, participants will be able to:", "Interpret and apply key customs legislations, regulations, and prohibition orders", "relevant to import/export activities.", "Prepare and manage import/export documentation, including declarations, valuation,", "classification, and exemption claims.", "Understand and apply INCOTERMS 2020 in structuring international trade", "agreements.", "Manage post-import activities such as audits, refunds, and duty drawbacks effectively.", "Apply correct SST treatment for imports and exports in line with current legislation.", "Strengthen compliance practices to minimize risks and ensure smooth cross-border", "trade operations."]

title: DIGITAL MARKETING & AI TOOLS KIT
description: Introduction: In the fast-paced digital economy, mastering the art of organic marketing is crucial for driving brand growth and sales without excessive ad spend. With over 4.8 billion social media users globally, free platforms like Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and WhatsApp have become powerful channels for connecting with customers. At the same time, AI has revolutionised how we create, optimise, and distribute content enabling marketers to scale their efforts with minimal cost. According to HubSpot, 82% of marketers actively use content marketing to drive business growth, while McKinsey reports that AI adoption can boost marketing productivity by up to 40%. This program integrates the best of both worlds: proven digital marketing frameworks for free platforms and AI-powered tools that help businesses generate engaging, sales-focused content quickly and effectively.

title: INCOTERMS 2020: SHIPPING IMPORT & EXPORT DOCUMENTATION PROCEDURES
description: The Incoterms 2020 provides comprehensive working knowledge of ICCs globally recognised commercial trade terms, which offer specific guidance for those participating in the import and export of global trade. The global economy has given business broader access than ever before to markets all over the world. Goods are sold in more countries, in larger quantities, and in greater variety. But as the volume and complexity of global sales increase, so do possibilities for misunderstandings and costly disputes when sale contracts are not adequately drafted. ICC Incoterms rules on the use of domestic and international trade terms address this risk by facilitating the conduct of global trade. Reference to an incoterms rule in a contract for the sale of goods clearly defines the parties respective obligations regarding topics such as risk, cost and arrangement of transport & customs clearance and reduces the risk of legal complications. Since ICC first codified a set of standard trading terms as the Incoterms rules in 1936, this globally accepted contractual standard has been updated periodically to reflect the evolution of international trade. The Incoterms 2020 rules take account of the increased attention to security in the movement of goods, the need for flexibility in insurance coverage depending on the nature of goods and transport, and the call by banks for an on-board bill of lading in certain financed sales under FCA rule. Incoterms 2020 also offers a simpler and clearer presentation of all rules, featuring an expanded introduction and explanatory notes. Incoterms 2020 is also the first version off ICCs incoterms rules to include a horizontal presentation, grouping all like articles together and allowing users to clearly see differences in treatment of particular issues across the 11 incoterms rules. Incoterms rules define the responsibilities of buyers and sellers for the delivery of goods under sale contracts. They are the authoritative rules for determining how costs and risks are allocated to the parties. Incoterms rules are regularly incorporated into sale contracts worldwide and have become part of the daily language of trade. Incoterms 2020 contains use of the 11 incoterms trading terms. It takes into account the latest developments in commercial practice and updates and consolidates some of the former rules. All sales contracts should make reference to the incoterms 2020 rules as the latest version of the Incoterms rules. The new incoterms 2020 launched on 10th September 2019 is effective worldwide as of 1st January 2020.
target_audience: This course is specially designed for those who are involved in: Import / Export / Shipping Operation, Freight Forwarding, Purchasing & Supply Chain Activities, Transporting, Bill Processing, Trade Documentation, Manufacturing, Sales Administration, Marine Insurance, Finance & Administration, Bankers, Customs Brokers.
methodology: Real-life examples and exercises will be used during the workshop to stimulate learning and to make workshop interactive and exciting.
learning_objectives: ["Understand the principles and key updates of incoterms 2020.", "Apply the correct incoterms rules to define responsibilities, costs, and risks in trade contracts.", "Master import and export documentation procedures and requirements.", "Navigate payment, logistics, and customs processes effectively to minimize trade risks.", "Enhance operational competency and compliance in managing international trade transactions."]

A survey by the Ministry of Health found that one in three Malaysian adults aged 16 years and above (29.2 percent) have a mental health condition after post-COVID statistics have shown an increase of 43% in depression and anxiety cases. This comprehensive 1-day training is designed to equip participants with essential knowledge and practical tools to effectively manage mental health challenges and stress in personal and professional settings. The course covers the fundamentals of emotional resilience, stress management techniques, and mental health awareness. It is ideal for individuals seeking to enhance their being, improve emotional intelligence, and build healthier coping mechanisms. Through a mix of experiential learning, discussions, and gamified activities, participants will leave with actionable strategies to handle stress, support mental health, and foster resilience.

Training is delivered in a highly interactive and experiential way. Concepts and background information are presented through group exercises, discussion and activities creating an environment that facilitates accelerated learning and application. Program Value Proposition A vast body of scientific evidence now exists on how, when, and why people say yes to requests. Among them is the study of NLP or Neuro Linguistic Programming. NLP is about modelling; studying, understanding, and transferring the skills of top performers in any field. By using NLP, your people will be able to enhance their regular activity into a focused, energetic and strategic experience. NLP is an advanced tool used by many successful professionals in a whole range of activities. The simplicity of the tool plus its effectiveness makes it a much sought after edge of todays professionals. Participants will learn, practice and assimilate these skills into their daily activities until they become unconsciously competent in these skills in a conducive save space.

methodology: Classroom
